intro: Psychotria sclerocarpa, commonly known as the hard-shelled Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with five petals and a prominent corona. The plant is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
